course.subject: CORE
course.name: Social Media: Collective Intelligence & Creativity
course.description: Web technology is now connecting a diversity of people and ideas and encouraging cooperation and collaboration. However, the nascent proliferation of fake news is beginning to have a corrosive effect on the open and peer-to-peer collaborations that are the underpinning of Web 2.0. The aim of the course is to make students aware of the tug of war between beneficial and harmful effects of this social media phenomenon.
course.prerequisites: a passing letter grade in CORE 1401 OR CORE 1402 OR CORE 1403 OR CORE 1404 OR LANG 1002 (prior to 2022-23)
